```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```


```{r}
# Sample data for four treatment groups
group1 <- c(10, 12, 13, 15, 11)
group2 <- c(9, 11, 14, 12, 10)
group3 <- c(8, 10, 9, 11, 12)
group4 <- c(12, 11, 10, 9, 13)

# Combine the data into a single data frame
data <- data.frame(
  Group = factor(rep(c("Group 1", "Group 2", "Group 3", "Group 4"), each = 5)),
  Value = c(group1, group2, group3, group4)
)

# Perform the ANOVA test
result <- aov(Value ~ Group, data = data)

# Print the ANOVA table
print(summary(result))


#Running an ANOVA + Tukey Test

# Sample data for four treatment groups
group1 <- c(10, 12, 13, 15, 11)
group2 <- c(9, 11, 14, 12, 10)
group3 <- c(8, 10, 9, 11, 12)
group4 <- c(12, 11, 10, 9, 13)

# Combine the data into a single data frame
data <- data.frame(
  Group = factor(rep(c("Group 1", "Group 2", "Group 3", "Group 4"), each = 5)),
  Value = c(group1, group2, group3, group4)
)

# Perform the ANOVA test
result <- aov(Value ~ Group, data = data)

# Perform Tukey's post hoc test
tukey <- TukeyHSD(result)

# Print the ANOVA table
print(summary(result))

# Print the Tukey test results
print(tukey)

```
